ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] A large number of "-50" status code in seeds-report.txt
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It is likely that some change to your scope rules is preventing necessary prerequisite URIs (DNS, robots) from being fetched, for some URIs. I would pick

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=pbKYKUQlcpwMlZ-AUR5KVyF8OHF-XXWwyp2VGe-gXit1

On 9/24/10 11:18 AM, jianxiongdong wrote:
> Hello,
>    I am working at AT&T interactive and  use heritrix-1.4.4 to crawl about 200,000 websites. For each site, the max hops is set to 2.
> When the hertrix job was done, i checked "seed-reports.txt"
>
> In this file,  the number of seeds with status code "-50" is 74681.

It is likely that some change to your scope rules is preventing 
necessary prerequisite URIs (DNS, robots) from being fetched, for some 
URIs.

I would pick one of the seeds that fails and launch a crawl with just 
it, studying the logs for all hints about what steps are tried. Does 
that same seed work with the default settings bundled with Heritrix 
1.14.4? With the default settings and *only* your max-hops=2 change? 
With your settings with max-hops=3?

In recent versions of our recommended DecideRule-based scope 
configurations, we include the PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule in the last 
position, so that even if other changes put in place rule-out needed 
URLs, they are again ruled-in at the end. Does your scope retain this 
rule in the last position?

- Gordon @ IA
